data.job_description:
• Data curious with a technical mind, including the ability to engage with all levels of our business
• Advance excel skills and programming experience developing business intelligence tools, including Microsoft Excel, Python, R, SQL and Power BI.
• Strong analytical, problem solving and reporting skills

Salary range from $109,612 plus super

At Hydro Tasmania, we’re leaders in renewable energy, powering Australia with clean hydropower. We really care about making a difference for better, but it’s a big job and we can’t do it alone. Which is right where you come in.

We are passionate about diversity and inclusion and welcome applications from qualified candidates of all ages, cultural backgrounds, abilities and genders. There’s a place for you amongst us to belong, and we welcome you to speak to us about any special requirements you may have to give you the best opportunity for success.

About You

The Data Analyst will be someone who seeks continuous improvement and innovation. You operate with a view to progress the business by acting reasonably and efficiently when dealing with decision making. It's imperative that alongside developed technical ability you also possess a strong ability to communicate effectively to reports, peers and colleagues. You will be able to engage stakeholders at all levels and demonstrated a strong collaborative approach.

A flexible, proactive and self-starter attitude will be essential, along with the ability to work to deadlines you will have a passion for driving best practice and enjoy streamlining processes. Your flair for presenting data in a convincing and easy to understand format assists you in comfortably communicating your work with a broad range of stakeholders. Agile and resilient, you can quickly adapt to shifting priorities. You will ideally hold a degree in a relevant discipline, coupled with several years experience working in a similar role and advance experience with data analysis and exposure to various software programs.

About The Role

You will support the business by providing technical and analytical support to our forecasting activities, delivery of information and data services supporting the business’s financial and operational activities. You’ll work collaboratively with a broad range of stakeholders across our business, establishing and maintaining stakeholder relationships. As the Data Analyst you will be responsible for;
• Constructing PowerBI reports and dashboards connected to enterprise data systems to effectively distil data into actionable insights
• Utilise data analytics and models to held change ways of working and reduce business waste
• Work with Commercial Finance to manage data integrity and add value to financial trading analytics
• Constructing PowerBI reports to replace and automate existing excel models
• Excellent analysis and problem solving skills
• Can do attitude with a willingness to learn
• Great communication & attention to detail
• Ability to work autonomously and eager to learn from others
• Ability to build sound relationships with stakeholders and business partnering experience based on trust

Further information can be found on the attached Position Description: PD - FIN - Data Analyst - HT4 - September 2023.pptx

What You’ll Get Back

This is an opportunity to grow your career and redefine your role in tomorrow’s industry landscape. We offer truly flexible work that suits you, a competitive remuneration package, and the rare opportunity to play a role in Australia’s renewable energy transformation while enjoying the – lifestyle Tasmania has to offer.

If you want to make a difference for better

Please attach your resume and a cover letter outlining what skills and experience you will bring as soon as possible. We will be running an agile recruitment process and will engage with suitable candidates as soon we have reviewed their applications.

Hydro Tasmania has been at the forefront of clean energy innovation for over one hundred years. We are Australia’s largest producer of clean energy – generating hydro and wind power – and the largest water manager in the country. Hydro Tasmania has 55 major dams, operates 30 hydropower stations and has built some of Australia’s largest wind farms. We also sell energy in the National Electricity Market through our retail business Momentum Energy, and deliver our expertise internationally through our consulting business Entura. Hydro Tasmania at a glance * Hydro Tasmania is Australia’s leading renewable energy business. We generate hydropower in Tasmania and trade electricity and energy-related environmental products (such as Renewable Energy Certificates) in the Australian market. * Hydro Tasmania is the largest water manager in Australia. * We own and operate King Island’s Huxley Hill wind farm and two diesel power stations on Bass Strait islands. They’re good examples of innovative use of combined renewable technologies. * We’re owned by the Government of Tasmania and currently employ over 800 people. We have assets worth around $4.8 billion.

• Closing Date: 13 October 2023, 9:00 AM

face2face reference: 591408

Location: Nationwide - Remote

Hours: Full-time

Contract length: 12 Months Contract + 3 x 1 Month (Pending approval)

Entry requirements: Australian Citizen + Ability to obtain Baseline

Pay range: $95.00 – 115.00 p/h inc super

About the role:

The Tertiary Skills and Pathways team is responsible for the unit mapping project, as part of its program of work. Unit mapping uses natural language processing techniques to create a connection between tertiary education learning materials (VET and HE units), and skills taxonomies. Unit mapping helps to identify skills taught in tertiary education, and their potential relationship to occupations and the labour market, to assist in analysis and advice on tertiary education delivery.

The team is working on a demonstration project basis with five key projects to design the end to end process of unit mapping, to continually refine the data science model, and to generate insights on the potential use of mapping outputs. The outputs of models are large, for example one university with approximately 3,000 units can have an output of approximately 30,000 skills mapped. Validation of outputs is a critical part of the mapping process to produce a model and results that are highly accurate.

Duties:
• Developing of a comprehensive internal and external validation process for very large data sets, to support improvement of data science models, and the quality of output data sent to partners. This may require an ensemble of approaches, for example statistical sampling, manual and automated approaches to validation.
• Managing internal validation processes before outputs are sent to project partners.
• Working closely with the data science team to provide feedback for the mapping model development.
• Analysing complex model outputs, to derive valuable insights for reporting to project partners, including visualisation techniques.
• Providing advice to technical services on interface design for a validation application for project partners.

Required experience/skills:
• Demonstrated experience in data analysis and process design, to create replicable data validation processes to improve data output quality.
• Excellent analytical skills, with strong attention to detail, and the ability to synthesise and critically analyse large volumes of structured and unstructured data.
• Strong skills and experience in data management, in particular how data can be effectively structured, analysed, presented and communicated, to achieve high-quality outcomes.
• Excellent communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate key data insights visually and in written form to a range of diverse stakeholders
• Well-developed interpersonal skills, including the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary setting.

Desirable experience skills:
• Experience in R Shiny, Python, SQL, anduser experience design.
• Understanding of, and experience working with tertiary education (HE and/or VET) and/or occupation and labour market data.
• Understanding and experience in data science, or related fields.
• Experience operating in a policy environment.

If this sounds like the role for you, and you'd like to learn more, click apply now. f2f Recruitment team will be happy to assist you.

#APS
• Thank you for your interest in this position with face2face Recruitment. Our advertisements automatically stay live for 30 days, even if the position is filled beforehand. Should you find this role closed, not all is lost. If you submit your resume to us as a general expression of interest, we will consider you for other positions that suit your talent and experience. We may well have current positions to fill and will certainly consider you for future suitable roles. Submitting your resume has the added bonus of getting your name in the mix for opportunities we fill without even advertising. All you have to do is send your resume to TeamICT@f2frecruitment.com.au.

APS6 Data Analyst

As an APS 6 Data Analyst, you’ll use your expertise in data analysis, modelling techniques and business knowledge to address business problems and support data-driven decision making.

You’ll use a variety of tools, languages and technical knowledge to research, extract, analyse and interpret data and results with a strong commitment to quality assurance, re-usability and curation of data sources and solutions. You’ll be accountable for organising your workflow and make decisions concerning your work area and team plans. You may be required to lead and manage the work of junior employees and be responsible for reviewing the quality of their work

Requirements:

• Expertise in using a variety of tools including different dialects of SQL (Teradata, MSSQL, Postgres or similar) and visualisation tools (PowerBI, COGNOS or similar)
• Skilled in extracting, analysing and interpreting data, delivering complex and technical results through logical, succinct reports and presentations
• Experience or an understanding in using version control software (Git, GitLab, TFS)
• Present complex and abstract information in an accessible and effective format suitable for their target audience
• Exercise sound judgment to provide detailed technical, professional, and policy advice in relation to complex problems and assist in strategic planning, program and project management and policy development
• Equip team members with their technical expertise and guidance to achieve a positive client experience.

Qualifications in a related discipline (i.e. Computer Science, IT, Mathematics, Statistics, etc.) would be highly regarded but not essential. Certifications in AWS, Azure, Power BI and Teradata would be looked at favourably.

Since this is a Federal Government Opportunity, it is a requirement for the candidate to be an Australian citizen.

Apply directly using the link provided or by submitting your CV. For confidential discussion, please don't hesitate to contact me: sara.alonso@randstad.com.au

EL 2 Data Analyst Director

EL 2 Data Analyst Director will be responsible for leading teams to develop complex data analytic solutions and respond to ad hoc requests for data and information to support the operation and delivery of business outcomes. You’ll apply your data and analytics knowledge to lead the development and implementation of technical data solutions by applying analytic techniques and methods.

You may be responsible for managing Smarter Data’s relationship with key partners, delivery of their program of work; provide high-level support and advice to senior executives; engage in complex problem solving and issues management. You will drive the development and implementation of data centric solutions through the data lifecycle from problem definition with clients through to measuring the effectiveness of implementation. You’ll lead teams, set work area priorities, allocate and manage resources and the performance of employees.

Ideal candidate:

• Natural strategic thinkers that show courage when faced with adversity, can think laterally and are willing to drive the organisational agenda

• Demonstrate they are excellent communicators who can tailor and present highly complex technical information to various audiences

• Strong established leaders who lead and manage technical teams in a data and analytics environment, managing workforce change, building collaborative practices and capability deliver quality results within timeframes

• Possess excellent relationship management skills and can work collaboratively with business partners to provide an outstanding client experience delivering contemporary, professional and efficient outcomes

• Have experience in project methodology with data and analytics and experience in leading technical delivery of large scale D&A initiatives in complex organisations.

Qualifications in a related discipline (i.e. Computer Science, IT, Mathematics, Statistics, etc.) would be highly regarded but not essential. Certifications or experience working in cloud platforms especially AWS would be desirable.

For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe. As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences. With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you! Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Australia.
Analytical mindset.

Job Requirements

Must be living in Australia for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.
Technical requirements to perform the work Access to a laptop or computer which uses:- A logon account unique to you- Anti-virus solution that is kept up to date, with regular scans performed- Only one member per household may apply NB. All products should be provided at your own expense. Benefits · Work up to 20 hours per week.· Earn a competitive rate of pay.· Develop your research skills.· Avoid the long commute.· Work from the comfort of your home office.· Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours! Apply Online Today! This is a freelance, independent contractor position. Additional information:Remote Job: Fully in-personEmployment type: Part-time

Job Description
• The main responsibilities of this role include -
• Assist in the preparation of reports and building complex data models
• Devise new data collection and analysis processes
• Work with key stakeholders to priorities information needs
• Analyse results and report findings to the business
• Identify and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
• Develop strategies to optimise the quality of statistical results
• Maintain database
• Research background materials, including relevant economic and financial data
• Assist in the development of long-range financial forecasts and related budgets

The Successful Applicant

The Successful Applicant will have the following -
• Bachelors degree in Business / Commerce or related discipline
• Ideally 1-3 years of experience, however, will also consider graduates straight from University
• Intermediate Excel skills
• Strong analytic skills and problem solving
• Strong communication skills
• Proficient in Power BI (preferred)

What's on Offer

New office currently being built

Opportunity to develop and enhance career

flexible working arrangements

Work closely with the CFO

Attractive remuneration and bonus

Flexible working arrangements

We are hiring freelance English speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.

This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.

Requirements
• Full Professional Proficiency in English
• You must be living in Australia for the last 2 consecutive years
• Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
• You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Australia
• Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
• Applicants must be 18 years or over.

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?
• Earn extra income

• Be your own boss

TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com

If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact us at sourcingteam54@telusinternational.ai

About The Company
Start your career with a Data Analyst Internship with a growing data science technology consulting firm. You will work with Senior Reporting Analysts and a Data Scientists to perform deep analysis using Python and SQL for real-world client projects.

Overview

As a Data Analyst Intern, you will become part of the Data Science team and support a range of data-driven and reporting activities. This company is seeking talented Data Analyst Interns to support projects using Python, Machine Learning, and AI. You will also gain experience using predictive analysis tools and techniques. Your Internship as a Data Analyst will see you working with a range of company and client data and using ETL tools and PowerBI to create dashboards. This opportunity is suited to graduates wanting to start their career in Data Analytics.

Data Analyst Internship Duties
• Performing data migration & data analytics under supervision from the Chief Data Scientist
• Statistical modelling using R and Python
• Data extraction, cleaning, and wrangling using the latest data science techniques
• Prepare concise data reports and data visualisations for stakeholders that will help in decision-making processes
• Present data using PowerBI and Tableau to highlight trends and findings
• Designing and developing relational databases for collecting data

What you will learn on your Data Analyst Internship
• Gain hands-on practical experience in Python, PowerBI, and SQL
• Learn AWS integration for large-scale projects
• Build high-powered visualisations using Tableau and PowerBI
• Enhance your core Data Analyst skills through real-world projects using Python, Machine Learning & Deep Learning capabilities

How to apply for this Data Analyst Internship?

To be considered for this Data Analyst Internship, you need to be a member of the CSA Internship Academy. To learn more about doing an Internship and to book a free Career Counselling and Internships phone consultation, click the button below. Career Training, Mentoring & Internship Program Management fees apply to become a member of the CSA Internship Academy.

Click Applyto get started.

• Work with a genuine market expert in a booming sector
• Established specialist with awesome client list
• Join a professional, fun environment with real flexibility

In a relatively short period of time Talent Insights has quickly established a strong reputation in the Data Science, Data Analytics, Customer Insights & Data Products sectors. We have quickly grown our client portfolio over recent years and now have a number of preferred supplier agreements in place with some of the largest businesses in Australia who often rely on us exclusively to help them attract Data talent. We work with most of the top data teams in Australia, whether; internal analytics functions, consulting firms and start-ups/product companies across various industry sectors including Consulting, Financial Services, Internet, Retail, Airlines, Telco and Loyalty Rewards businesses.

It's an extremely exciting industry; understanding how everyday customer data is captured and used for marketing, targeted advertising and helping businesses drive insights to gain a competitive advantage.

We have an exciting growth opportunity for a full-time recruitment consultant to join our Data Science and Data Analytics desk, our highest billing desk, and working alongside one of the best consultants in the industry. You will become a true market specialist in a sector which is growing exponentially. Salary $80k - $110k depending on experience.

Experience required:
• At least 10 years' experience in a Recruitment Consultant role and previous recruitment experience in data would be amazing, but we will also consider, Technology, Marketing, Risk, Strategy, Digital or Professional Services recruitment
• Experience building a contract desk and managing contractors would be awesome but not a requirement
• Superior influencing, negotiation, persistence and decision-making skills
• Strong networking skills with both clients and in securing the best candidates
• Proven understanding of the recruitment process
• Confident over the phone and face to face meeting new people
• We are a relationship driven business, proud of our reputation for genuine business partnering relationships. It is crucial that you also share this long-term vision and approach to truly become a business partner for both clients and candidates

Competencies we are looking For:
• Drive (Sense of urgency)
• Determination
• Self-Discipline(Time Management, Organised)
• Solution Oriented(Problem Solving)
• Communication/Good Communicator (Ability to influence, active listening, observe / demonstrate body language)
• Emotional Intelligence(Resilience/Bounce Back, Self-awareness, awareness of others etc.)
• Integrity
• Work Ethic(Hard Work)

What we offer:
Salary $80 - $110K depending on experience
Work with experts in the Data sector & Training in the Data Science & Analytics space / Real Flexibility post Covid-19 / Modern CBD office environment, No KPI's / Casual dress / extra annual leave / Very competitive commission structure

About The Role

In this role, you will become a trusted and relied upon financial analyst whose primary objective is to elevate the team's expertise in regulatory financial modelling. By aiming to foster a deeper understanding of financial regulations and their impact on the organisation's operations and overall financial position. This capability empowers the team to offer invaluable insights into the commercial and financial dimensions of regulatory compliance, ultimately enhancing the quality of regulatory reporting and decision-making processes.

Concurrently, there is a focus on enhancing the team's corporate and financial modelling, a pivotal component in supporting TasNetworks strategic decision-making. Financial models serve as indispensable tools for forecasting, conducting scenario analyses, and evaluating the financial ramifications of strategic objectives. Additionally, the role provides support for vital team-managed processes, encompassing treasury and debt management, and extending assistance to the Investment Governance Committee, which oversees the businesses major investment decisions. This also includes creating, reviewing and refining models using a DCF approach for potential new deals for the business.

Furthermore, data gathering and validation are central to the role's responsibilities and are essential for providing meaningful and insightful analysis.

Lastly, the role encompasses the development and upkeep of a comprehensive long-term financial model, which serves as a strategic compass for long-term financial planning and decision-making.

About Us

At TasNetworks, we are proud to be the leading provider of electricity transmission and distribution services in Tasmania. With our unwavering commitment to safety, reliability, and customer satisfaction, we deliver a superior electricity supply to over 285,000 residential, commercial, and industrial customers. Our core values and forward-thinking approach make us the trusted brand for all your energy needs.

By joining TasNetworks, you will experience the difference of a company that puts customers first, values safety above all, unifies in the face of challenges, and embraces diversity and forward thinking. Together, we are powering a bright future for Tasmania.

About You

To be successful in this role, it is imperative to embody TasNetworks' Core Capabilities, which form the cornerstone of all positions within the organisation.

Having a solid foundation in business, commerce, accounting, or a related professional field, coupled with a demonstrated period of relevant experience, is essential.

Proficiency in Excel, including the ability to construct intricate financial models, is crucial. Moreover, a deep understanding of valuation techniques pertaining to the evaluation of future investment opportunities, including mergers and acquisitions, is highly valuable.

Success in this role hinges on possessing robust analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills, allowing for the transformation of data and complex analysis into comprehensible insights that facilitate informed decision-making processes. This also includes the ability to summarise data efficiently in order to present to various stakeholders across the business, including executives and board members.

What's on offer

This is a full time permanent opportunity based at our Lenah Valley Office in the South of the state. At TasNetworks we want to power a bright future for our people, our community and our customers. We offer a supportive work environment where safety is at the heart of everything we do. We offer our team excellent benefits including
• Great professional development opportunities
• Flexible work arrangements
• Paid volunteer days
• Free onsite parking
• Onsite gyms (or gym rebate if unavailable)
• All the equipment you'll need to be successful

We are proud to be work180 accredited, check us out

How to apply

If this role and working at TasNetworks is of interest we look forward to hearing from you. TasNetworks is an Equal Opportunity employer and is committed to responding to every applicant. We encourage applications from all members of the community, including people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds and mature aged people. Please ensure you attach a cover letter outlining how your skills and experience are aligned with this role, and an up to date resume. For more information about this opportunity and to acquire a position description, please click

Applications close 11:59pm Sunday 15th October 2023

For further information about the role, please contact

To be eligible for this position, you are required to have Australian citizenship, permanent residence or a current valid visa that allows you to fulfil the requirements of this role.

data.job_title: Senior Spatial Platform and Integration Analyst
data.job_description:
Unit: City ICT & Data
Division: City Enablers
Location: Town Hall
Employment status: Permanent Full-time
Classification: Municipal Officer Level 4
Agreement: Hobart City Council Enterprise Agreement 2021
Salary: $95,251 per annum + 12.5% superannuation.
• Work in a dynamic team
• Build and shape a positive team culture
• Flexible working arrangements for a better work/life balance

About the role

The role is responsible for the development of advanced integration artefacts, integration flows and related applications for Council that result in solutions which connect both Council and external systems including IoT edge devices to support both operational and analytical requirements of the City.

Role accountabilities include providing specialist advice and guidance on GIS matters across the organisation.

Learn more about the role in the position description: Senior Spatial Platform and Integration Analyst

About you

Are you looking for a challenging and rewarding career in spatial platform analysis and integration? Do you have a passion for delivering innovative solutions that support decision-making and planning?

The desired applicant will have a degree in Spatial Sciences or similar and several years of satisfactory relevant experience with the acquisition of appropriate skills through approved training.

About us

The City of Hobart offers something for everyone, with connections between nature, history, culture, businesses and each other. We are proud to provide a range of services and facilities that support the wellbeing, safety and participation of the community as well as continuously look to improve and embrace new approaches to achieve better outcomes for all. With an industrious and diversified economy, wherever your skills, talents and passions lie, we can offer you the opportunity to have a rewarding career with ongoing learning and development opportunities.

We recognise contributions to our workforce and offer:
• Above Award wages and Employer Superannuation at 12.5% with salary sacrifice options.
• Flexible work arrangements including the option to apply for a nine-day fortnight.
• A wide range of paid leave entitlements.
• Health and Wellness programs, including onsite gyms.
• Discounted membership at Hobart Aquatic Centre.
• Ability to purchase additional leave after 12 months of service.
• An Employee Assistance Program that offers onsite visits.
• Corporate Health Plan discounts with BUPA, St. Lukes and Medibank.

Learn more about what the City of Hobart can offer you.

The City of Hobart is committed to building an inclusive community and workplace. As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage applications from people of all backgrounds, abilities, ages and identities.

Learn more about our vision, mission and values.

How to apply

Before you begin

You will need to read the position description prior to commencing your application as you will be required to address the key duties, skills and knowledge for this role in 600 words or less.

Ensure you have copies of your resume, qualification/s, and your Driver Licence to attach at the end of your application.

If you require any further information specific to this role please contact Emily Brown, Senior Spatial and Visual Analytics Analyst, on 03 6238 2905 or email browne@hobartcity.com.au.

All applications must be made in the online portal, and you can save your application as you progress through the stages until you submit your final application. If you have any issues with submitting your application, please email details of the issue to recruitment@hobartcity.com.au.

Selection process

Candidates are initially selected for interview based on the details provided in their application.

The City of Hobart assesses all applications based on merit.

Positions are filled, based on how well the successful candidate meets the requirements of the position.

Learn more about the selection process on our website.

Applications close 5pm Monday 9 October 2023.

$111000 per annum, Discretionary 10% Bonus

Australia's foremost private consortium, boasting an annual revenue of $400 million and demonstrating steady expansion, operates within the manufacturing and engineering sector.
Given its robust business growth, a recently established role has emerged within the well-established and seasoned FP&A team.
The Finance team is an integral part of the Group.

The position will support the group businesses which design, engineer and manufacture high performance luxury/niche cars, parts and accessories in domestic and export markets, motor racing and sports equipment wholesaling.

The Walkinshaw Group has a long history and has recently undergone a period of significant change and is looking for an enthusiastic candidate willing to learn about the automotive manufacturing business in a broad-based financial role.

Reporting to and work closely with the Group FP&A Manager, you will have the opportunity to directly influence the performance and success of the group.

This is a fantastic opportunity for a highly motivated analyst looking to gain experience and impact across the whole P&L.
The role will provide financial insight into the operational performance of the automotive businesses of the Group through:

Monthly interrogation of accounts and preparation for customer invoicing across all vehicle lines (Cost-plus Business model).
Detailed analysis of Revenue and Cost to drive better financial management processes and account governance.
Presentation of Monthly Results, Forecast and new pricing to customers.

Drive improved organisational commercial acumen through the analysis and reporting on actual costs of production (materials, labour, consumables, production damages), stock adjustments, labour time-sheeting monthly.
Support partnering for value with operational department heads to review ongoing performance.
Involvement with business case financial modelling and analysis.
Assistance in the development of the rolling 24-Month forecast and annual budget.
Support during the year end audit and preparation of statutory accounts.

This position is suited for someone studying towards CA/CPA (completed is beneficial) but not a must, ideally if you have a couple of years Management Accountant experience OR come from a professional services background, looking to make a first move into industry.

• ‘Work where it works’ for you and your clients
• Be part of a team where everyone belongs, and individuality is celebrated
• Contribute to the financial wellbeing of our 2 million+ clients across Australia

The difference you will make at Insignia Financial

In the role of the Salesforce Technical Business Analyst, you will take an active and forward-looking approach to enhance project delivery. This includes providing leadership to analysts and collaborating closely with the Delivery Manager to ensure the successful execution of team activities and deliverables.

You Will Make a Difference By
• Conducting in-depth technical analysis, addressing complex business requirements and processes
• Serving as a pivotal link between stakeholders and the delivery team, taking charge of complex issues across various applications that involve multiple parties
• Evaluating existing processes and systems, offering recommendations for process enhancements
• Providing subject matter expertise and conduct business analysis for intricate projects
• Developing position statements on complex subject matter inquiries
• Assisting in Incident Management during Business as Usual (BAU) operations, identifying the root causes and facilitating defect remediation within stipulated SLAs
• Providing comprehensive support throughout the end-to-end delivery process, including technical requirements, testing, and change management for planned releases and maintenance windows as needed

A Little Bit About You
• Possess business and/or technology expertise, acquired within the Financial Services sector or other related industries
• Extensive experience, with a significant portion dedicated to working with Salesforce
• Hold tertiary qualifications or possess equivalent industry experience
• Demonstrate prior experience in various business practices, with a particular focus on Financial Services, especially in superannuation and fund management
• Expert in systems design, integration, and function/data analysis within specific business functions
• Exhibit effective communication and interpersonal skills, crucial for effective stakeholder engagement, including the ability to conduct showcases
• Adopt a proactive approach to problem-solving, critical thinking, and the identification of opportunities for improvement
• Lead by example by embodying the culture and values that align with the expectations of the team and Insignia Financial

Life at Insignia Financial

From people just starting out, to those about to retire – every day we help more Australians secure their future. Helping our clients reach their financial goals sooner is our specialty. Few others can match the range of wealth management products and services we offer.

Insignia Financial is an ASX Top 200 company, and one of one of Australia’s leading wealth managers. We use our scale and expertise to invest in a future that’s better for everyone. We believe success comes from caring about people, consistent performance, and outstanding service. And we recognise and celebrate the value of individual difference: this applies to employees and clients alike.

Diversity and ensuring our people feel they belong is important to us, we take pride in putting our people, as well as our clients, first and value and celebrate diversity within all our teams.

We have a Women in Technology community which exists to bring together female and non-binary people within the tech world at Insignia Financial. This supportive forum is eager to progress and make change in the technology space – does this sound like you?

With many of us now working from home more than the office, we understand the importance of flexibility. As we work in a hybrid environment, you’ll ‘work where it works’ for you, your team, and our clients. We also offer varied and flexible leave offerings, including 12 weeks paid parental leave and an extra day of leave each year.

We encourage our people to have an impact on the broader community we serve through volunteering leave.

At Insignia Financial, it’s important to us that our people feel secure about their own money. We have an extensive financial wellbeing offering available to our people, including access to financial advice, mortgage, and insurance brokers, Will and estate planning services and more.

Join us and contribute to achieving our ambition of creating financial wellbeing for all Australians through living our Principles: be human, deliver what matters, stronger together, keep it simple and do what’s right, not what’s easy.

To apply

Please submit your resume with a covering letter by clicking on "Apply Now".

Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment.

Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time.

At Insignia Financial, we have a culture of belonging. We are an ‘every person’ organisation that welcomes and appreciates everyone for who they are. If you need assistance or an adjustment during the application process because of your personal circumstances, please reach out and let us know. We recognise and celebrate the value of individual difference.

Job Title
Senior Finance AnalystJob Description Summary
Job Description

The Client Finance business unit is responsible for managing overall client operating plans across many properties and facilities under Cushman & Wakefield management (ranging from commercial, retail, industrial assets).

The Senior Financial Analyst supports the Head of Client Finance by driving the delivery of accounting and financial services to internal stakeholders and external clients.

About the role:
Preparation and delivery of Month end journals for Outgoings & Utilities, including the commentary around the key variances from the budgets
Managing the day-to-day financial operations across the portfolio, including rent roll payments, invoicing, and financial reconciliations
Collaborates with the leasing team to ensure accurate and timely recording of leasing financials, including rent escalations, lease incentives and tenant recoveries
Conduct financial modelling and scenario analysis to evaluate leasing proposals, renewals, and other financial decisions
Maintaining records/evidence for SOX compliance
Preparing monthly dashboards, ad-hoc reports and provide key information/analytics for business cases
Preparing and ensuring timely, accurate delivery and presentation of client(s) annual rental commitments from a P&L, Balance Sheet and cashflow perspective under AASB16
This role will involve supporting the Transaction managers, Lease managers and wider finance in preparing operational/financial reporting
Collaborate with other internal finance and leasing teams to ensure proper accounting treatment, financial compliance and to implement financial controls of best practice

About You:
Comfortable in the details and with large data sets and analysis
Clear and effective communication skills, including the ability to translate finance/ reporting outcomes to non-finance client stakeholders
Experienced Qualified Accountant (CPA/CIMA/CFA or CA) preferred
Knowledge and experience of AASB16 Lease accounting preferred
Knowledge and experience of Internal Control Frameworks (SOX) preferred
Advanced Excel Modelling
JD Edwards, Power BI and Anaplan system knowledge an advantage

Why join Cushman & Wakefield?
We're committed to providing work-life balance for our people in an inclusive, rewarding environment.

We achieve this by providing a flexible and agile work environment by focusing on technology and autonomy to help our people achieve their career ambitions.

We focus on career progression and foster a promotion from within culture, leveraging global opportunities to ensure we retain our top talent.

We encourage continuous learning and development opportunities to develop personal, professional and technical capabilities, and we reward with a comprehensive employee benefits program.
We have a vision of the future, where people simply belong.
That's why we support and celebrate inclusive causes, not just on days of recognition throughout the year, but everyday.

We embrace diversity across race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or persons with disabilities or protected veteran status.
As part of our ongoing commitment to RAP, Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island Islanders are highly encouraged to join us

We ensure DEI is part of our DNA as a global community - it means we go way beyond than just talking about it - we live it.
If you want to live it too, join us.
As an equal opportunity employer, Cushman & Wakefield encourages Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander and female candidates to apply. Cushman & Wakefield promotes safety at all times.

Cushman & Wakefield is committed to equity in employment and our goal is to have a diverse, inclusive, and barrier-free workplace.

If you are a person with a disability and need the job posting in an alternative format or any other accessible accommodations during the hiring process, please email your request
.
Please refer to the job title and job location when you contact us.

data.job_description:
Who are we?
UpGuard’s mission is to protect the world’s data. We obsessively seek out elegant, robust ways to enable our customers to find, acknowledge, and remediate cyber risks. With UpGuard, organisations leverage our security expertise and software to automate what were once laborious, spreadsheet-driven processes–monitoring the attack surface of hundreds of vendors or assessing the security of their own infrastructure. UpGuard is used by some of the world’s largest, fastest growing and most innovative companies.

Why are we hiring for this role?
As UpGuard continues to scale at an increasing rate, each of our teams, from Product to Sales, is becoming more data and insight hungry. As a result, our central Analytics and BI function is bandwidth constrained and needs to scale with our business growth.

As a Senior Business Analyst, you will be responsible for ensuring that all teams not only have access to the data they need but also provide powerful insights that can help UpGuard scale and make important decisions. You will be able to use your understanding of business structure and processes to understand stakeholder needs and provide them with the correct information and insights in the most useful and concise format.

We are looking for someone with 4+ years of experience working in both Analytics and Business Operations roles. Candidates should have a Bachelor's Degree in a Mathematical, IT, Science or Engineering field. As our team is currently small, we're looking for someone who is self-sufficient.
What you will accomplish
• Understand the business data needs of various teams within the organisation, from stakeholders that do and do not have a technical background. A successful candidate will not only be able to digest requirements but also converse with stakeholders in a constructive and comfortable manner, as you are providing “customer support” to other teams.
• Be able to transform raw data into useful insights through the use of our Business Intelligence platform and present information in a way that conveys powerful and pertinent insights for stakeholders. Our BI platform is Looker, so we are looking for candidates who are familiar with both the Explore/Look/Dashboard side of Looker as well as have experience with the Developer side of Looker.
• Be able to learn and understand our business processes, from our sales pipeline structure to our product usage metrics.
• Be able to undertake projects around trend analysis, seasonality and other more complex mathematical analyses on behalf of stakeholders.
• Be able to not only suggest areas of improvement for our processes, teams and infrastructure but also be able to plan, implement and test the proposed solution.
What would give you an edge? We have a Google Platform-based BI-stack. These are the technologies and skill sets we are looking for:
• Looker is our main BI platform: a candidate should be familiar with Explores, Looks, Dashboards and the Developer interface - maintaining dimensions and measures, creating and maintaining models, and being able to run and debug raw SQL queries.
• Google Sheets when we need to explore data in more detail: you should be comfortable with functions like pivot tables, vlookup, and charting.
• CloudSQL (PostgreSQL) and BigQuery for storage and query: be comfortable with writing complex queries.
• Experience with broader data sourcing and storage platforms such as Google Analytics, and Sales CRMs, and how they interact and connect with one another.
What's in it for you?
• Rapidly growing user base: Work directly with some of the world’s largest, fastest-growing, and most innovative companies
• Interesting problems, at scale: Deeply explore the ever-evolving world of cybersecurity, with a platform processing billions of data points daily
• Learn from industry-leading experts: Our security research has been featured in The New York Times, The New Yorker, The Washington Post, TechCrunch, Bloomberg, Gizmodo, Engadget, Forbes, ZDNet, and The Guardian
• Impact: See the impact of your work on a daily basis, with data and impact available on dashboards you have access to
• Generous compensation: Competetive salary & stock options.
• Great perks: Grocery and gym reimbursements, flexible work arrangements, learning and development stipend, and generous PTO package
My Startup Gig ran an independent review into life at UpGuard. To see what it's like to work at UpGuard, check out their survey results here.

Before starting work with us, you will need to undertake a national police history check and reference checks. Also please note that at this time, we cannot support candidates requiring visa sponsorship or relocation.

UpGuard is an Equal Opportunity Employer and qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status.

About Alooba

Hello! We are Alooba - a skills assessment platform for analytics, data science & data literacy. Our customers use us to better understand their people and their job candidates. We are like the ‘Moneyball’ of hiring, helping businesses focus on the things that matter and removing those that don’t. The result? A fairer, cheaper, faster and more accurate hiring process that focuses on the skills needed for the job. Our vision is to create a world where everyone can get the job they deserve. Can you help us achieve that?

Our culture is very important to us. We value no-nonsense people who use common sense to get sh!t done and make it happen. You’ll put our users first, and focus on improving our product and yourself every day. You’ll be able to straddle the need to work very fast and push stuff live, while maintaining a high standard and taking care of the details. You really must care, and this can’t just be ‘a job’ for you. And when work time is over, it’s party time!

Our hiring process always starts with a fair, skills-based quiz on our platform, customised for the role. This will help us both understand your skills, ensure everyone is treated fairly and you’ll get a chance to see what you’ll be building. If you ace the quiz, you’re guaranteed an interview. No matter what happens, you’ll see your score at the end of the quiz.

We are, genuinely, an equal opportunity employer. We also don’t care about things that traditionally appear on job ads like ‘years of experience’, university qualifications etc.

The Role

We currently have a small team of remote developers, however we’re looking to set up our core development office in Sydney at Fishburners. We’re looking for a set of strong senior software engineers to help bring our product to the next level, with a major overhaul of the system architecture, using a service oriented approach and expanding our feature set.

You should have experience building well structured systems and are keen to work in the fast paced startup environment with a drive to do whatever it takes to make it happen. As we are still a small company, you will have a direct impact on the success of the business. You will be the driving force behind the implementation of the features and functionalities you’ll be working on.

You will work directly with the CTO, founder and a small team of developers to build out our assessment platform to be an enterprise grade web application to serve our small but growing user-base spread across the world.

Our application is built with PHP (Laravel/Lumen), PostgreSQL, and React.js and is running on AWS. We are looking for capable people that can help expand our product and build it to scale with our users. You will be responsible for designing, developing, testing and maintaining the application and supporting services.

Responsibilities
• Take ownership of features and functionality and see it through from conceptualisation to productionisation
• Design and develop highly scalable, and maintainable code
• Design and develop system database schemas and RESTful API interfaces
• Thoroughly test new functionalities and existing systems
• Manage infrastructure as code and utilize CI/CD pipelines

Benefits
• Unlimited opportunities to grow your skill set in a fast-paced startup environment.
• No corporate bureaucracy, red tape, endless meetings and other big company nonsense - work directly with the CTO and founder on a daily basis.
• 5 days paid learning leave per year.
• Competitive salary and share options.
• The chance to get in early on the next big thing, and leave your legacy.

Must Have Requirements
• A can do attitude
• Attention to detail
• Ability to understand and interpret user needs
• Good problem solving skills
• Solid understanding of Object-Oriented Programming principles and patterns
• Solid understanding of Relational Databases and SQL
• Strong communication skills

Nice to Have Requirements
• Experience working at a start-up
• Working knowledge of PHP
• Working knowledge of PostgreSQL
• A good understanding of internet security best practises
• Experience building RESTful APIs and integrating with 3rd party APIs
• Experience with Docker and CI/CD pipelines
• Experience managing AWS services
• Frontend web development experience using HTML, JavaScript, CSS, and React.js

Job Types: Permanent, Full-time

Salary: $90,000.00 – $140,000.00 per year

Work Remotely:
• Temporarily due to COVID-19

COVID-19 Precaution(s):
• Remote interview process

Leading Mid-Tier Financial Investment company is offering a 12-week Financial Analyst/Trader Internship to Banking & Finance students and graduates. This firm provides financial research data, insights, and trading analysis to corporate clients in investment firms. During your Financial Analyst/Trader Internship, you will work with some of Australia's most experienced finance executives. Get one-to-one career guidance from leading finance managers too during your 12 weeks of Internship.
Financial Analyst/Trader Internship Roles and Responsibilities?

Analyse global equity, foreign exchange and derivatives markets.
Rotate through our divisions of responsibility and provide ideas to grow and improve the business.
Research, propose ideas and solutions, and present findings to the Senior Management Team.
Assist in creating performance reports, specifically for financial reporting.
What you will learn during the Financial Analyst/Trader Internship?
Essential Financial Market Software Systems used for financial analysis projects.
Hands-on finance experience with exposure in the understanding of analytics and reporting.
Skills in Project Management to assist in data and analytics reporting projects.

How to apply for the Financial Analyst/Trader Internship?

To be considered for this finance internship, you need to be a member of the CSA Internship Academy. To learn more about our Finance Internships and to book afree Career Counselling and Internships phone consultation, click the button below. Career Training, Mentoring & Internship Program Management fees apply to become a member of the CSA Internship Academy.
